greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of 2*sin(45*Pi/128).
comment: This is the value of R(45, x), with the monic Chebyshev polynomials of the first kind R (A127672) which has a solution (among the 45 real ones) x = 2*sin(Pi/128) = sqrt(2 - sqrt(2 + sqrt(2 + sqrt(2 + sqrt(2 + sqrt(2)))))) = A303984. See the comment in A303984 where this constant x appeared erroneously in a version of the exemplum secundum of Adrianus Romanus (Adriaan van Roomen). This appears in the first Romano link given below.
link: Index entries for sequences related to Chebyshev polynomials.
formula: 2*sin(45*Pi/128) = sqrt(2 + sqrt(2 - sqrt(2 - sqrt(2 + sqrt(2 - sqrt(2)))))).
maple: a:=evalf(2*sin(45*Pi/128)/10,150): b:=[]: for n from 1 to 105 do
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, May 06 2018
